trait.name: Artillerist's Eye (CR 2 or Higher, 3/Day)
entries: Immediately after making an attack or damage roll with a ranged weapon, the artillerist can roll a {@dice d8} and add the number rolled to the total.

action.name: Multiattack (CR 4 or Higher)
entries: The artillerist makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Ranged Weapon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage PBd6 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Sidearm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

action.name: Volley (CR 8 or Higher, 1/Day)
entries: The artillerist rains down a hail of ammunition or weapons in a 20-foot sphere centred on a point it can see within 60 feet. Each creature within the area must make a {@dc 12+PB} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage PBd10} piercing damage. A creature takes half as much on a success.

bonus.name: Overwatch (CR 6 or Higher, 3/Day)
entries: The artillerist  can ready a ranged weapon attack as a bonus action.

From slingers to archers to javelin throwers, artillerists are the standard ranged warriors of most armies. While their skills and equipment can vary greatly, they specialise in dealing damage from a distance, supporting allied infantry while in turn being protected from enemy infantry.

entries.name: Artillerists across the Multiverse
entries: In Cyranos, the term Toxotai is often used to describe artillerists. Despite the term normally relating specifically to archers, the term can be loosely used for any light artillery.

Similarly, in the Northlands, the term Bogmadr is used as a blanket term for multiple forms of artillery, despite literraly refering to archers. Bogmadr can most often be found on ships and protecting forts.

entries.name: Using Scaling Statblocks
entries: This statblock is intended to be a generic creature that can be quickly inserted into a variety of situations and at a variety of power levels. The hope is that statblocks like this one can provide simple and quick ways to bolster combat encounters or create simple encounters on the fly. They are not, however, intended to provide the drama and complexity of major climatic battles. As such, it is recomended that you use these statblocks alongside more specialised ones, rather than purely scaling ones, particulary for the more dramatic encounters.

These statblocks can be used at any CR within the range described in the tag. For example, a creature with the "Scaling 1-10" tag can be used at any CR between 1 and 10. It is possible to use it at other CRs but not recomended.

variant.name: Optional Extras
entries: At the DM's discretion, the artillerist may gain additional traits to add more flavor and diversity to the characters faced by the party. The following are appropriate examples of such traits. The DM may also wish to add racial traits, such as a dragonborn's breath weapon.

items: {@b Arcane Weapon}. The artillerist's Ranged or Thrown Weapon attack and Volley deals a damage type of the DM's choice.
{@b Darkvison}. The artillerist has darkvision out to 60 feet.
{@b Resistance}. The artillerist has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.

{@b Yanking Shot (CR 2 or Higher, 3/Day)}. When the artillerist hits a creature with a ranged attack, the weapon or ammunition magically returns to the toxotai's hand or quiver. The creature hit by the attack is pulled towards the toxotai up to a number of feet equal to 5xPB.
{@b Piercing Shot (CR 4 or Higher, 3/day)}. When the artillerist hits with ranged weapon attack, they can deal {@dice 1d8} piercing damage to a second target within 5 feet of the first target.

{@b Pinning Shot (CR 6 or Higher, 3/day)}. When the artillerist hits a creature with ranged weapon attack, it can force that creature to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 12+PB). On a failure, the creature is {@condition slowed|J:general} until the start of the artillerist's next turn. On a success, the creature is instead {@condition hampered|J:general} for the same duration.

trait.name: Reckless Attacks
entries: At the start of its turn, the hulk can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Forceful Strikes (CR 2 or Higher)
entries: Once per turn, when the brute hits a Medium or smaller creature with a melee attack, it can push that creature 10 feet away from it.

trait.name: Hardy (CR 8 or Higher)
entries: The brute has resistance to bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack (CR 4 or Higher)
entries: The hulk makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Heavy Melee Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4+PB} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage PBd8 + 4} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

action.name: Sidearm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

bonus.name: Furious Action (CR 6 or Higher, 3/Day)
entries: The brute takes one of the following actions as a bonus action; {@action Attack} (one melee weapon attack only), {@action Grapple} or {@action Shove}.
Hulk are imposing figures on the battlefield, masters of taking, and dealing, damage.

variant.name: Optional Extras
entries: At the DM's discretion, the shieldbearer may gain additional traits to add more flavor and diversity to the characters faced by the party. The following are appropriate examples of such traits. The DM may also wish to add racial traits, such as a dragonborn's breath weapon.

items: {@b Arcane Weapon}. The hulk's Heavy Melee Weapon attack deals a damage type of the DM's choice.
{@b Darkvison}. The hulk has darkvision out to 60 feet.
{@b Resistance}. The hulk has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.
{@b Frenzy}. When an allied creature the hulk can see within 30 feet is damaged by an attack, the hulk can use a reaction to move up to half its speed towards the attacker.

trait.name: Shields Up
entries: While wielding a shield and within 5 feet of a friendly creature that is also wielding a shield, both the shieldbearer and the creature gain a +1 bonus to their AC and saving throws. Multiple creatures can benefit from this trait, but each creature can only benefit once at a time, even if another creature within 5 feet has this trait.

action.name: Multiattack (CR 4 or Higher)
entries: The shieldbearer makes two Spear or Sidearm attacks. It can replace one attack with a Shield Bash attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage PBd6 + 3} piercing damage or {@h}{@damage PBd8 + 3} piercing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they must succeed on a {@dc 12+PB} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sidearm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

bonus.name: Goad (3/Day)
entries: The shieldbearer chooses a creature it can see within 30 feet that can see or hear the shieldbearer. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 12+PB}) or become {@condition taunted|J:general} by the shieldbearer until the start of the shieldbearer's next turn.

bonus.name: Quickdraw
entries: When the shieldbearer makes a ranged Spear attack, it can make a Sidearm Attack as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Spear Guard (CR 2 or Higher)
entries: When a creature enters the shieldbearer's reach, it can make a special opportunity attack, using its Spear attack, against that creature.

reaction.name: Protection (CR 6 or Higher, 3/Day)
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the shieldbearer is targetted by an attack, the shieldbearer can impose disadvantage on the attack roll. It must be wielding a shield to use this feature.

Shieldbearers are the standard heavy infantry of most armies. Armed with shields and spears, shieldbearers are trained to protect themselves and allies, often forming defensive lines between the enemy and their objective.

trait.name: Minion
entries: The recruit is a minion as described on page 10 of Flee Mortals! by MCDM Productions. If the recruit takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the recruit takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

trait.name: Shields Up (CR 2 or Higher)
entries: While wielding a shield and within 5 feet of a friendly creature that is also wielding a shield, both the recruit and the creature gain a +1 bonus to their AC and saving throws. Multiple creatures can benefit from this trait, but each creature can only benefit once at a time, even if another creature within 5 feet has this trait.

trait.name: Enhanced Attack
entries: When the recruit hits a creature with a group attack and at least three recruits joined in the attack, the recruit can impose one of the following effects:

items: {@b Overwhelm (CR 4 or Higher).} The target is {@condition hampered|J:General} until the end of its next turn.
{@b Penetrate (CR 6 or Higher).} The recruit deals damage to another creature within 5 feet of the target equal to half the attack's damage. The effect can only be used for a melee Spear attack.
{@b Eviserate (CR 8 or Higher).} The target begins {@condition bleeding|J:general}.

action.name: Spear (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1 + PB} piercing damage.

action.name: Sidearm (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3+PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1 + PB} slashing damage.
Recruits are often the lowest ranked and least experienced troops in any army, however, they do usually have some training and can often be effective in large teams.
